class MediaManager

Detailed Description

Media Recorder. Initialization of the resources is done in the constructor. Releasing of the resources is done in the destructor. In general, the methods of this class will return MediaManager::FeatureNotSupported if the corresponding feature is not supported, e.g. due to hardware constraints.

MediaManager::MmfResult MediaRecorder::SetMute (  BOOLEAN  mute_on  )  [virtual]
 

This method Mutes/Unmutes the audio. If the mute_on is true, then the audio rendering is paused. If the mute_on is false, then the audio rendering is resumed.

Parameters:
mute_on [IN] Mute Flag. If mute_on is true, mute is turned on. If mute_on is false, mute is turned off.
Returns:
MediaManager::Success if video recorder successfully mutes/unmutes the audio, otherwise MediaManager::GeneralError.

MediaManager::MmfResult MediaRecorder::Unzoom (   )  [virtual]
 

This method nullify the zoom changes caused by the Zoom method, i.e. it actually resets the zoom factor to 1. It shall be ignored if there is only audio or the video has not been zoomed. Note: Zoom factor 1 means that the whole content captured at the camera is visible on the video out window and is stored in the media sink (i.e. clipping/cropping should be avoided) but it does not mean that the video has to be in the same size (resolution) as on the camera, e.g. if the original camera capture size is 640-by-480 pixels but the video out window size and the recorded file resolutions (see DisplaySettings/RecordSettings) are 176-by-144 pixels, then the video is usually automatically downscaled to this size (if supported) and a zoom factor 1 would correspond to a 'real' downscaling factor 1/3.636 (If fractional scaling is not supported, then clipping/cropping as well as downscaling shall be applied).

Returns:
MediaManager::Success if media player successfully sets the zoom factor to 1, otherwise MediaManager::GeneralError.

MediaManager::MmfResult MediaRecorder::Zoom (  BOOLEAN  zoom_up  )  [virtual]
 

This method changes the zoom level of the video. It applies for the preview (video out window) as well as for the media sink, i.e. in general, on the video out window the same content shall be visible as that stored in the media sink. If the maximum upscaling factor has been reached and this method is called with zoom_up=TRUE, it shall be ignored. If the maximum downscaling factor has been reached and this method is called with zoom_up=FALSE, it shall be ignored. In case there is only audio, this method shall be ignored as well.

Parameters:
zoom_up [IN] If TRUE then the video shall be upscaled (to the next available level). If FALSE then the video shall be downscaled.
Returns:
MediaManager::Success if media player successfully sets the zoom level, otherwise MediaManager::GeneralError.
